writing_prompt: Every morning, Will Solace wakes up next to Nico di Angelo, the love of his life, and every morning begins with laughter, kisses, and the occasional battle to get out of bed—until one day, Nico suggests something that changes their routine forever.
story:
The best feeling in the world was waking up next to Nico di Angelo. Will Solace smiled as he snuggled deeper into the blankets, his eyes drifting open to find Nico's dark lashes cast shadows over his angled face. The morning light danced across Nico's features, illuminating the sharp planes of his cheeks and nose, making him look even more breathtakingly beautiful. Will's heart swelled with love as he reached out to gently brush a strand of hair out of Nico's face.

Nico stirred, his eyes fluttering open to meet Will's gaze. A soft smile spread across his face, and he whispered, "Good morning, my love." Will's heart skipped a beat as Nico's voice sent shivers down his spine.

Their cat, Connie – or Constable, as Nico liked to call her – meowed loudly from the foot of the bed, demanding attention. Nico chuckled and tossed off the covers, revealing his toned physique. Will's eyes roamed over Nico's body, and he felt a familiar flutter in his chest. Nico caught him staring and winked, saying, "You're going to get us into trouble, Solace."

Will grinned, feeling a surge of playfulness. He tickled Nico's sides, and Nico let out a mock shout, defending himself with a pillow. The battle for dominance ensued, with Connie joining in, pouncing on the pillows and sending feathers flying. They collapsed in a fit of giggles, their sides aching from laughter.

As they caught their breath, Nico suggested, "Hey, why don't we try something new today?" Will's curiosity piqued, he asked, "What did you have in mind?" Nico's eyes sparkled mischievously as he replied, "How about a picnic breakfast in the park?"

Will's heart skipped a beat. "That sounds amazing!" He threw off the covers, and they began preparing for their impromptu adventure. As they packed a basket with pastries, fruit, and coffee, Will couldn't help but feel grateful for this life they'd built together. The little moments, like this, were what made their relationship so special.

As they strolled through the park, hand in hand, Will felt a sense of contentment wash over him. The sun shone brightly overhead, casting a warm glow over everything. They found a quiet spot beneath a willow tree, and Nico spread out a blanket. Will sat down beside him, feeling the soft grass beneath them.

Nico handed him a cup of coffee, and Will took a sip, savoring the rich flavor. "I love you even more for the breakfast in bed," Will said, smiling at Nico. Nico's eyes crinkled at the corners as he replied, "I love you for being my partner in crime, Solace."

As they sat together, watching the world wake up around them, Will knew that this was what he wanted – a life filled with laughter, love, and adventure, all shared with the person he loved most. And as Nico leaned in to kiss him, Will knew that this was just the beginning of a new chapter in their journey together.

writing_prompt: Your partner insists you can look through their phone anytime, but when you do, you discover a collection of candid photos of yourself—each one capturing a moment you didn’t even realize was special.
story:
Nico and Will were lounging on the couch, engaged in a heated debate about whose turn it was to do the dishes. Their friend, Travis, had just gone through a rough breakup, and they were discussing the importance of trust in relationships. "I mean, if you're really secure in your relationship, you should have nothing to hide," Nico said, tossing a pillow at Will.

Will caught the pillow and grinned. "That's easy for you to say, but what if your partner has something on their phone that they don't want you to see?" Nico raised an eyebrow, and Will held up his phone. "You can check my phone anytime, I don't care. I have nothing to hide."

Nico chuckled and rolled his eyes. "I don't need to check your phone, Will. I trust you." But Will's words stuck with him, and later that evening, while Will was in the shower, Nico found himself picking up Will's phone. He wasn't snooping; he just wanted to see if Will was serious about having nothing to hide.

As he scrolled through Will's photos, Nico's eyes widened in surprise. There were hundreds of pictures of him – candid shots of him laughing, sleeping, and even just staring off into space. Nico's heart swelled as he realized that each photo captured a moment he didn't even remember, let alone realize was special.

There was a photo of him making pancakes in the kitchen, flour covering his face and a huge smile on his face. Another of him reading a book on the beach, his hair messy and his eyes closed. And one of him simply sitting on the couch, staring at Will with a look of adoration.

Nico felt a lump form in his throat as he scrolled through the photos. He had no idea Will had taken so many pictures of him, and he couldn't understand why Will had kept them all. He looked up as Will walked out of the shower, a towel wrapped around his waist.

"Hey, what's wrong?" Will asked, noticing the look on Nico's face. Nico held up the phone, and Will's eyes dropped. "Oh," he said, a small smile on his face. "I guess I should have warned you about those."

Nico shook his head, feeling a little overwhelmed. "Why did you take so many pictures of me?" he asked, his voice barely above a whisper. Will walked over to him and sat down beside him on the couch.

"I wanted to remember all the moments that made me fall in love with you," Will said, taking the phone from Nico's hand. "The little things, the big things – everything. I wanted to capture it all, so I could look back and remember how I felt." Nico's eyes welled up with tears as Will showed him more photos, each one telling a story of their time together.

As they sat there, scrolling through the photos, Nico realized that trust wasn't just about having nothing to hide; it was about being vulnerable and open with each other. He leaned over and kissed Will, feeling grateful for the love they shared. "I'm glad you took those pictures," he said, his voice filled with emotion. Will smiled and wrapped his arms around Nico, holding him close.

writing_prompt: A mischievous makeup artist convinces their reluctant partner to star in a video, only to reveal a hilariously unexpected transformation—what happens next?
story:
Hello, my little demigod darlings! Today is a very special day because I finally persuaded my boyfriend, Nico, to be in a video with me! I know, I know, it's a miracle. He's been dodging my camera for ages, but I managed to wear him down with my irresistible charm and promises of pizza.

Nico walked into the room, looking adorably grumpy, and plopped down in the chair in front of me. "Fine, but make it quick," he said, eyeing the makeup brushes and cameras. I grinned mischievously and got to work.

As I began to apply the makeup, Nico started to relax, and we chatted about our day. I asked him about his latest adventures with the Hunters of Artemis, and he regaled me with stories of their latest quest. I listened intently, making supportive noises and asking questions, all while sneaking in subtle touches and teases to make him laugh.

But as I reached for the final product – a mysterious, glittery eyeshadow – Nico's eyes narrowed. "What's that?" he asked, his voice laced with suspicion.

"Trust me, tesoro," I said, winking at him. "It's just a little something to make the video pop."

Nico raised an eyebrow but didn't argue, and I quickly applied the eyeshadow. As soon as the sparkles touched his skin, the room was filled with a bright, rainbow light. Nico's eyes widened in surprise as he looked down at his hands and saw that they were slowly transforming into... fluffy, Care Bear paws.

I burst out laughing, and Nico's eyes snapped up to mine, a mixture of shock and amusement on his face. "You sneaky, sneaky boyfriend!" he exclaimed, his voice shaking with laughter.

I grinned, triumphant. "Gotcha!" I said, snapping a photo of his adorable, Care Bear-ified face.

Nico playfully swatted at me with his new paws, and I giggled, dodging and weaving around the blows. "You're going to pay for this," he threatened, his eyes sparkling with mirth.

I just laughed and handed him a microphone. "Time to channel your inner Care Bear, Nico! Let's get this video started!"

With a mock-sigh, Nico began to sing a ridiculously catchy tune about the importance of hugs and friendship. I joined in, and we spent the rest of the afternoon laughing, singing, and making silly faces at the camera.

As the video came to an end, Nico turned to me, still in his Care Bear form, and said, "You know, I never thought I'd say this, but... that was actually kind of fun."

I beamed with pride. "I told you it would be! And don't worry, I'll turn you back into a demigod soon."

Nico chuckled and leaned in, his Care Bear nose rubbing against mine. "I'm not sure I want to go back. This is kind of liberating."

I laughed and wrapped my arms around him. "Well, you can stay a Care Bear for a little while longer, then. But just remember, I'm the one who gets to control the makeup from now on."

Nico grinned, and we shared a kiss, surrounded by the sparkles and magic of our little video adventure.

writing_prompt: While navigating the Labyrinth, Nico encounters a strange, freckled boy claiming to be from the future—and his future boyfriend.
story:
A loud thud made Nico jolt awake. He was navigating the Labyrinth, trying to find a way out, when he stumbled upon a strange, freckled boy. The boy was wearing a bright orange t-shirt with a faded logo of a pizza place on it, and his eyes sparkled with a mischievous glint.

"Hey, Nico!" the boy said, waving at him with a goofy grin. "I've been looking all over for you."

Nico's instincts screamed at him to be cautious. "Who are you?" he asked warily, his hand on the hilt of his sword.

The boy chuckled. "I'm Will Solace, your future boyfriend."

Nico raised an eyebrow. "What?"

Will nodded enthusiastically. "Yeah, I know it's weird. I've traveled back in time to meet you."

Nico's skepticism was evident on his face. "Time travel? You expect me to believe that?"

Will shrugged. "Hey, it's a thing. I've got a time-traveling device that looks like a wristwatch. It's really cool, I promise."

Nico crossed his arms, his eyes narrowing. "I don't think so."

Will sighed, looking dejected for a moment before his face brightened up again. "Okay, okay. I get it. You're not going to believe me. But just hear me out, okay?"

Nico raised an eyebrow, intrigued despite himself. "Go on."

Will took a deep breath. "I'm from the future, and in the future, we're... well, we're a thing. We've been together for a while, and I just wanted to meet you before... you know, we actually meet."

Nico's confusion deepened. "What do you mean?"

Will hesitated, looking around the Labyrinth nervously. "I don't know if I should tell you. It's all really complicated. But... but I just wanted to see you, I guess. And give you a message."

Nico's curiosity got the better of him. "What message?"

Will's face turned serious, and for a moment, Nico saw a glimmer of something deeper in his eyes. "Be careful, Nico. There's going to be a lot of stuff happening soon, and I just... I want you to be okay."

Nico's instincts were screaming at him to be wary, but there was something about Will's words that resonated with him. Maybe it was the genuine concern in his eyes, or maybe it was just the absurdity of the situation, but Nico found himself wanting to believe Will.

As they talked, Nico realized that Will was... different. He was quirky and awkward, but in a charming way. And despite the absurdity of the situation, Nico found himself enjoying Will's company.

But just as things were starting to make sense, Will glanced at his wristwatch and frowned. "Oh no, I've got to go. My time is up."

Nico felt a pang of disappointment. "Wait, what? You can't just leave!"

Will smiled wistfully. "I'm sorry, Nico. I really am. But I'll see you again, I promise. Just... just be careful, okay?"

And with that, Will turned and disappeared into the Labyrinth, leaving Nico staring after him in confusion.

As Nico continued on his way, he couldn't shake the feeling that his life was about to get a lot more complicated. And he couldn't help but wonder if he would ever see Will again.

writing_prompt: After surviving the horrors of Tartarus, Will and Nico have developed quiet rituals to soothe their lingering fears. One sleepless night, they find themselves dancing in the kitchen, holding each other close as the weight of their shared past fades into the rhythm of the present.
story:
The darkness outside seemed to press in on the small cabin, making the shadows on the walls twist and writhe like restless spirits. Will's eyes snapped open, his heart racing as the familiar weight of Nico's body beside him proved insufficient to calm the lingering fears that still haunted his dreams. He slipped out of bed, careful not to disturb Nico, and padded softly into the kitchen.

The red night light above the sink cast a comforting glow, illuminating the scattered cocoa puffs on the counter, a reminder of their late-night snack. Will's eyes drifted to the small radio on the windowsill, and he flipped it on, the soft strains of a jazz standard filling the room. The music was a balm to his frazzled nerves, and he let the melody wash over him as he began to sway to the rhythm.

Nico appeared in the doorway, his eyes sleep-heavy, but a small smile playing on his lips as he took in the scene. "Dancing alone, Solangelo?" he asked, his voice low and husky.

Will's cheeks flushed, but he held out a hand, and Nico slid into his arms, their bodies swaying together in perfect sync. The music wove a spell around them, drawing them deeper into the present, away from the horrors of Tartarus. As they danced, the weight of their shared past began to lift, like the ebbing tide.

Their movements were slow and sensual, a gentle give-and-take of pressure and release. Will's hands roamed over Nico's back, tracing the familiar contours of his shoulders, the curve of his spine. Nico's fingers threaded through his hair, his touch sending shivers down Will's spine.

In the kitchen, surrounded by the comforting detritus of their daily lives, they found a sense of peace. The music swirled around them, a living, breathing entity that pulsed with their heartbeats. As the song drew to a close, Will leaned in, his lips brushing against Nico's ear. "You're my anchor, Nico," he whispered, his voice barely audible over the music.

Nico's arms tightened around him, holding him close as the final notes faded away. "You're mine, Will," he replied, his voice full of conviction. "We're each other's home."

In that moment, the darkness outside receded, and the shadows on the walls stilled. The only sound was the soft hum of the radio, and the quiet beating of their hearts, a reminder that they had found a love strong enough to overcome even the deepest fears. As they swayed together, the music still echoing in their minds, Will knew that they would face whatever the future held, side by side, their love a beacon of hope in the darkness.
